website_summaries.verdict: This adjustable weight bench offers an affordable and durable option for users of all ages.
pros: Bench is simple to adjust into 5 different positions, making it easy to perform a variety of exercises
Offers 5-inch foam rollers that will help you work out comfortably
Features a maximum user weight load of 250 pounds and a maximum user weight and lift load of 430 pounds
Expertly crafted from premium materials for long-lasting versatility
cons: Bench may wobble and wiggle during workouts
Can be difficult to assemble the bench

customer_reviews.title: good bench
customer_reviews.text: easy install, good quality, put a small piece of wood make 85 degree for shoulder press
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Quality
customer_reviews.text: I had concerns before I buy it because some people gave negative feedback to this product. I am 5'11" and it fits good. In order to help you how it fits to my body I've added a photo using this product, so that you can have an idea how it will look like when you use it. Even though it seem like my head doesn't fit at the top of the bench, it fits properly and it doesn't bother me at all. In a nutshell, I love this product, very useful and made with a quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bench
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Im a 6ft athlete this was easy to build took me 30 min it came with its own tools. I didnt install the leg part. That just gets in the way you do not need it. Its only for amatures or if you wanna do maybe sit ups or for support but trust me athletes dont use that. So i just out it aside incase i wanna install it in the future. The material feels so good. I use it for bench press or for dumbells or leg kick outs and dips. And no you dont feel a gap were the seats meet. I give it a A+
customer_reviews.author: Luis Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Bench
customer_reviews.text: Took a little to set up ~30 min or so including unpack-aging time. Got this for my wife for our workout room She loves it as it is lightweight and easy to change up the various angles. It is sturdy and stands firm. I am 5'8'' and when lying flat I have to scoot slightly down to not have the top of my head hanging off. This unit had sturdy parts and bolts/screws resulting in a rather sturdy product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: works well, has held up
customer_reviews.text: Works well, feels stable, having owned it for more then a year it is starting to get some wear/tear in the side padding, not sure if I did that moving it around or jamming something into or it just happened. Either way not concerned about it, it is a piece of workout equipment not something to look pretty. Should be able to get many more years out of it. I will add it is awkward to move, not due to weight but design but I guess that is what you get to have incline/decline bench.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: It is very sturdy and easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this bench a long time ago, it has changed my workout game. It is very sturdy and easy to adjust. The material and stitches are well constructed and are attractive. It is also easy to clean. The assembly only took about 10 minutes. It does not have a 90 degree angle but it has other effective angles and lies flat. Since having this bench, my workouts have much better form. There are other benches out there that are more expensive but this is all you need and is a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley BouchardTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: A quality addition to any home gym!
customer_reviews.text: This bench is cost effective, sturdy and easy to put together. It took me about 30 minutes, though the instructions that come with it are pretty crappy, it's pretty self explanatory. This bench is awesome for in home use, it's not wobbly and it's very comfortable to use. It is heavier than I expected so if you're planning to move it around or store it after each use, it is pretty cumbersome and definitely not the most mobile. However, if you plan to use it and leave it in the same general area, you've found your choice. It's easily adjusted and made of quality strong steel.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M

customer_reviews.title: It will do for now.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Price -Prime -Solid enough Great for moderate lifting or beginners. I don't think it will handle heavier weight safely. Cons: -Hard Padding (I will hange this if it softens in the coming months) -CHEAP materials; you get what you pay for...the nuts and bolts of this thing are very cheap and strip very easy if you accidently over tighten. -Very limited incline/decline angles. I am considering modifying the stand in order to allow an complete upright setting. Not very pleased with my purchase. I'll keep it for now and replace it later on. If you plan using this for benching, I would recommend spending a bit more for a purpose built incline/decline bench, not this.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, easy to put together, and not expensive. If you're looking for weird features, look elsewhere but if you want a solid weight bench that is easy to put together and use, then you'll want this one. I gave 4 stars and not 5 only because I have to turn this bench in my workout space sometimes and it's only possible to pick up the bench from the end where the fixed seat is (near the sit-up stirrups). It would be great if there were a way to lock down the adjustable part of the bench and be able to pick up the bench from either end.
customer_reviews.author: David Keadle

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Bench
customer_reviews.text: My son recommended this bench after he bought one for his apartment. I was downsizing my home gym in preparation for a move. This adjustable bench is stable and has a small footprint. I primarily use it for dumbell presses and flys. I am 5'8", weigh approximately 190 pounds, and max at about 90 pound dumbells. This bench works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a good quality bench. My only issue with it is a minor one. The black plastic "pegs" at the ends of the leg extension part always pop out very easily. I've already lost a few of them. They aren't required by any means to use the bench, but it does seem like they weren't fitted properly.
customer_reviews.author: John ¥

customer_reviews.title: Nice bench but arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.text: The bench itself was easy to assemble. It is just as described. Feels sturdy even on the carpet. My husband who is 6 ft 1inch and my son who is 6ft 4inches both use it without difficulty. I rate it 3 stars only because it arrived damaged. The package was intact but the bench had a tear. It was not with the trouble to ship back such a large item.
customer_reviews.author: Darra

customer_reviews.title: Good value, may need some reinforcement of cover with tape on bottom
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble. Parts seem okay for now. They seem to fit well. I had to use a long handle Phillips screwdriver to screw the seat on tight. The plastic covering is stapled to the bottom of the seat and the bench. I will probably reinforce that with Gorilla Tape. I got this for my partner so that he would have something on our deck to work out on and it fits the bill. I have used it for negative sit-ups, free weight exercises and some basic to intermediate yoga exercises. For $90, it certainly meets our needs so far.
customer_reviews.author: JanBear

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely satisfied - sturdy, comfortable - great quality/price ratio
customer_reviews.text: The bench came quickly, was easy to put together and it very sturdy. It is fairly light and the seat and back cushions are very soft and good to sit on. I don't have the feeling that it is flimsy and when I sit on it with my weights it does not budge. I would definitely recommend this product because this is very good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT STARTER BENCH
customer_reviews.text: I am well satisfied with this bench. Easy to put together, it came with the tools needed to put it together, all pieces lined up perfectly. Bench looks nice, stable, welds are good. Bench is light and easy to move around. For a starter bench I think it is an excellent value and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Philip H

customer_reviews.title: Love This Bench
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I've had a number of weight benches of varying size and cost. I am really pleased to have bought this Universal adjustable bench. It is really well made. Since I weigh 220 lb and am 6'4" so with my size in addition to the weight I lift, I was really concerned about the construction, especially the adjustable arm and it's support mechanism. All are solid materials and construction. It is lighter than some of the other benches I've had, but it is well made. I would buy this brand of their other products based on the value of this one........Price + Quality= Value!!!
customer_reviews.author: Good Bad n Ugly

customer_reviews.title: Ok bench, cheap materials. Ages poorly.
customer_reviews.text: Low quality materials. Ok bench for low weight, infrequent use. I’ve only had it 2 months, used it lightly & carefully maybe 8 times and it’s already showing signs of wear and tear - including a small rip in the covering of the padding.
customer_reviews.author: Storms Brother

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this item
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am pleased with this weight bench. It took me about an hour to assemble it. Assembly was relatively straight forward and the instructions are both thorough and good. It is a solid design and it will have no problem supporting my weight at 150lbs. I'm sure it is also sturdy enough to handle the weight of much heavier people 200-250lbs. I'm also pleased with how it looks. It is not cheap looking and has a pretty cool/stylish look. I consider this a value at the $108.00 dollars that I paid, plus ZERO shipping because I am an Amazon Prime customer. I purchased it to use with Beachbody's Body Beast program and I expect it to do splendidly.
customer_reviews.author: VoyageAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Great bench, simple design
customer_reviews.text: Buy it! At first I thought the price was a bit steep for a weight bench. Once the box arrived i was able to assemble it within a half hour or so. All I can say is that all the parts used in the assembly are high quality, even the washers are bent to fit snug on the rounded fittings. The product description say up to a 250lb limit....after putting this thing together that figure seems laughable, it could easily hold 400+ S O L I D. If any thing I would say the fabric upholstery on the bench its self feels a bit soft for a piece of gym equipment. This product was built to last that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: It does everything it says it does and the padding is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The only two downfalls, and they aren't necessarily the product's fault since it is exactly as described, are that it doesn't decline as much as I was expecting and it is slightly shorter than the commercial gym benches. Again, this was described in the article as -10 degrees, but -10 degrees is practically nothing for a decline bench. Also, the height of the bench is told and is exact but I find my head frequently on the top edge of this bench and I'm an average height of 5' 11". Item is great for this price, however, and is well worth the money spent if you're in the market for a versatile bench.
customer_reviews.author: The Siren

customer_reviews.title: Defective bench
customer_reviews.text: The frame itself (before assembled) isn't balanced causing the whole bench to wobble. I'm sure I just received a defective bench and I could've contacted them for services for a new frame. I didn't want to go through the hassle of taking the whole bench apart and repacking then reassemble after the new frame comes in. It's a lot of work and no one should have to go through the whole process.
customer_reviews.author: xchang05

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and value for your money! This thing is made solid and comfortable and was easy to assemble. Came packaged very well and arrived quickly with no issues. My wife and I are very satisfied knowing we'll continue to get much use out of this. The incline / decline positions are sturdy, practical and effective. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: seat angle doesn't adjust
customer_reviews.text: Too much $ for this bench. Any decent adjustable bench needs to have a seat that has an adjustable seat angle--otherwise you will slide forward when doing incline benching, flies, etc. To build an adjustable bench with a fixed seat is just plain poor design. Plus the plastic feet come off constantly and eventually crack and break. You can do a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome R. Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I looked at so many benches and ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I looked at so many benches and this one caught my eye as it was easy to change positions on. Now that we have it I have to say It is quick to change from sitting to bench presses and I love how light it is as we store it on the other side of the room when not in use. It does lay flat, which many benches out there do not. I also love the ankle rest because after a hard workout you sometimes need an extra hand up. Well worth the extra money
customer_reviews.author: Kelly BShiny

customer_reviews.title: a nice starter bench!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, a very solid and well-made bench. I am 6'0" and wish it were an inch or two longer, but I can manage. It is stable enough for most uses, but it is a little shaky for step ups, so I don't recommend standing on it. Fairly easy to put together, nice material and padding.
customer_reviews.author: rhubarb jones

customer_reviews.title: Very solid, durable bench
customer_reviews.text: This bench is just what I needed. Easy to assemble (tools are included). Took about 20 minutes total. It doesn't weigh any more than about 15 pounds, so it's easy to move around or hang up as I do with it. The seat and back pads have plenty of cushioning. I'm completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Little Shaky, but holds up after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Shakes - I use this for exercises like Step up, Box jumps, etc., and its a bit shaky. I add weights to keep it steady. Black Caps - The black caps on the arm that holds the back seat keep coming off. You will need to glue these to the base. - Black caps on legs easily come off if you slide the bench. So you will need to almost always pick this bench up.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck - quite versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money! I absolutely love this bench. Some people have said they don't think that it has 5 positions, it does, it has 4 normal positions and one slight decline position (not a big decline, just a small decline angle). I use this for several weight exercises including bench press variations and also use it for various core exercises. I'm not a big guy so I'm not sure how it handles for larger people, but for an average size man it works great.
customer_reviews.author: PicklesMcGhee

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice bench for under $100
customer_reviews.text: I had been watching the price. Two weeks ago was $160. ( Nov 2015) Then it dropped to $92. I bought it. One week later it is $219. It's a nice bench for under $100. I am sure you can find a better bench at the $200+ mark. Took 45 minutes to assemble. There was one screw the wrong size. Great build quality. You can find a better price if you shop.
customer_reviews.author: sPySuB

customer_reviews.title: Safe, sturdy, and well made.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bench. Very sturdy. Feels safe and stable as well. I even did some situps on it with no trouble (I'm 169lbs, 5'10"). So happy to get this on sale. Well worth it. Don't settle for anything less. Cheaper benches aren't the way to go. Go for safety and quality like this. Be sure to check your box for any loose hardware. I had to get a couple of loose washers from there that fell out of the package.
customer_reviews.author: Cobalt Blue

customer_reviews.title: wonderful little weight bench
customer_reviews.text: As noted in several reviews, it's just a tad short if you are 6 foot or taller. I am about 5' 11" and a half and have to sit just a little bit forward of where I might normally sit so that my head is supported (barely). however for me it's not a big deal. I would also like one more position that is a bit more upright, but again not a deal breaker. I read the reviews carefully and knew what I was getting and have been very pleased with it. assembly was easy and the bench is surprisingly light, yet has a very sturdy feel. For the price I'd buy this again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: cyclinguy

customer_reviews.title: Great value for $100
customer_reviews.text: Cons: no wheels, could be too short for people 6 feet tall. Pros: the leg raiser is completely removable. solid, not shaky and comfortable cushion. Tricks: if you think the gap between two cushions are too wide when being a flat bench, reassemble the "butt cushion". Make the side pointing outwards to point inwards. The gap would be much smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Hulala

customer_reviews.title: other than that it's a really good bench for the price
customer_reviews.text: I would've given this a 5 but the fact that this bench doesn't go 90 degrees or even close to it for shoulder press really bothers me..other than that it's a really good bench for the price..the bottom plastic cap also falls off from time to time UPDATE: I found some legs to a couch or something I had bought and was able to put them in that gap and it seemed to work for the 90 degrees position..they haven't popped out so it looks like a go :)..you could do a metal rod of some kind too
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: great addition to home gym
customer_reviews.text: This bench has held up really well for the past four years. With regular use from multiple family members, it has only suffered a few tears that tape took care of.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Willows

customer_reviews.title: It was extremely easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I had cancelled my gym membership because I didn't make enough effort to go out. I ended up buying this bench to put in my room as a reminder to get a workout in. I don't have a lot of space in my room but this bench fits perfectly. It was extremely easy to put together. Pretty straight forward so you don't really need to read the directions to figure it out. The only problem I have it that the plugs that fit in either side of the cushion keep coming out. I can probably just glue them in but it would be easier if they were screwed in. Other than that, the bench works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great bench for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Got my item yesterday it was very easy to assemble. The bench was very stable able to hold my 230lbs frame easily. It is a good combo with my Bowflex dumbells.. all I need for what I'm trying to do. Hope this helps anyone who is thinking of buying..
customer_reviews.author: Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Simple - Sturdy - A good deal
customer_reviews.text: For the $86 price this is a solid bench for my home use - it does seem to have a little play with the arm due to it being a quick adjust system but otherwise its pretty much all I could ask for. Takes maybe 5 minutes to put together without much hassle.
customer_reviews.author: frooglemo

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to put together and well made
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to put together and well made. The only improvements I would recommend are, first to make the lowest position of the bench to be a little more of a decline (15%) and for that position to be as securely supported as the other four. Second the base supports would be better if they were made one inch wider. That being said this is a good bench that is very safe if correctly used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOTS OF BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!!
customer_reviews.text: Great little bench!! My 13 year old daughter and I do Body Beast and P90X and this bench works awesome! It's very sturdy yet light enough to easily move out of the way when not in use. Some reviews say it was hard to put together but it took my daughter and I about twenty minutes and it was pretty easy. I've owned a $350 bench in the past was destroyed in a fire and for the price of this bench, it stacks up pretty good. Of course the more expensive bench was much more heavy duty, but for what we use it for, it works great! Well worth every penny!! Would highly recommend and would buy again! Happy lifting!!
customer_reviews.author: Niaish

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bench for the money.
customer_reviews.text: 3 1/2 years later, after almost daily use, it finally has a small split in the fabric. I still REALLY like this bench. I wish it went down lower for declines and up one more notch for incline front raises, but I knew it was like that when I got it so no surprises, there. I also could do without the leg braces, but they are easy enough to avoid. For the price you can't beat this bench. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Anne Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great bench
customer_reviews.text: Great bench for its price, built with good quality metal. Here are my cons and pros: CONS: If your taller than 5'10 you will not fit. The plastics on each corner comes off randomly when moving bench. Instructions are horrible, you have to figure out the installation yourself. PROS: Great price for this bench. Has 4 different positions. Heavy duty bench, you can use plenty of weight on this. Overall i gave it a 4 star because the price to the make up of this bench is incredibly, i would recommend this bench to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great Bench
customer_reviews.text: Bench is great - assembly was pretty good. A few bolts need to be tightened but they just won't budge. It works well, a tiny bit wobbly but that doesn't hamper it's safety or performance just notable. The instructions are not very thorough, I found some older ones online that were better.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Solid. Quality design and manufacture. Easy to assemble. Comfortable. I specifically bought it for the decline position so I could do sit-ups--and I could have bought one that ONLY declines for less money, but for a bit more, why not add 4 additional positions? Good call: I've already expanded my workout to take advantage of other settings. Even though it's perfect for now, it's possible that at some point in the future the 10° decline won't be enough, but an 18" length of 2x6 under the front legs will solve that. I'm seriously very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R Howard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value. Well made and worth double what I paid.
customer_reviews.text: Much better than I expected for the price, I.e great value. Easy to assemble and feels quite substantial. I was worried with some negative reviews, but knew Amazon return policy would allow for a refund if defective. I'm a bit over 200 lbs and with 100 lbs of Dumbbells (300 lb total)I don't feel any movement or reason to be concerned with bench being a safety hazard. Quickly change between flat and inclined position with one hand while sitting on bench. Only disappointment is no 90 deg / upright setting for deltoid presses.
customer_reviews.author: Dtemp

customer_reviews.title: Basic home workout bench
customer_reviews.text: I started working out at home and realized I needed a workout bench. Nothing fancy. I am really happy with this bench. I agree with most reviewers that the assembly instructions are lacking but with my experience putting together IKEA furniture it was easy enough to figure out. I love the fact that I can adjust the various inclines. And yes it does decline to -10 degrees. You adjust the bench arm to sit past the back leg. There is a great video in another review demonstrating this. I was concerned about storage because I don't have a lot of space but it's not as big as I thought and fits in just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sound Maven

customer_reviews.title: Okay For The Price
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad bench but not great. There's no place for the support to lock into place in the fully upright position. The plastic end caps on the base of the support fall off repeatedly. I finally duck taped them to keep them in place and add some friction to it so that it would stay upright. I wouldn't mind a few more settings between upright and the middle position as well. But all-in-all, it works for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: A. Maddox

customer_reviews.title: The instructions are pretty much non-existent although it's fairly easy to figure out
customer_reviews.text: I just put this together....only cursed about 20 times. The instructions are pretty much non-existent although it's fairly easy to figure out. I had to take apart a couple of pieces and flip them around because it was not clear which side went where. I like the design. Time will tell whether it's a sturdy bench or not. I'm a small woman, about 125 lbs, so if it doesn't hold up for me..... I'll update the review after using it for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Bean

customer_reviews.title: quality!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and awesome packaging. Wasn't damaged when I received it. Took about 20 min to assemble, came with nuts, blots, and tools (I used my own tools) I'm about 5'10" and the back rest is just right for me, if your taller the 6' then this might not be your cup of tea. The positions are great for chest, upper chest, shoulders, and other muscle groups or workout. I will probably install another upper bracket for a more vertical position. Over all this bench seem to be good so hopefully it'll hold up to the test
customer_reviews.author: RyanEnergizerTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: The instructions on putting it together is just one giant picture that doesn't say anything. It's pretty easy to put together, and seems like it's going to be good for the dumbbell lifts I bought it for
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Best in class
customer_reviews.text: I would agree with most positive comments on here. This is a sturdy, gym-level weight bench for half the price of the "best seller." Bowflex had their catalog in the box and their bench looks virtually identical but is twice as much. I am glad I got this one. I am 230 lbs and this thing is rock solid and instills confidence that it isn't going to break even when laying down with 45lb dumb bells. For the money, can't see topping this.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice bench, but like others have said the instruction ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice bench, but like others have said the instruction sheet is worthless, so unless your good at putting things together you'll probably need some help. The legs don't level off well on a basement floor. Throwing a mat under it solves the problem, but this is why i gave it 4 stars instead of 5. BTW: I don't know why the company didn't put a stop at 90 degrees. I did this myself with a C-clamp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bench, great price, OK weight capacity, OK instructions.
customer_reviews.text: The assembly instructions are pretty basic, one page which points numbers to parts & nuts/bolts. It's not hard to figure out, though. It took less than 30 minutes, that was with using the included tools(for science!). It's light, easy to use/move, and works well. The only welcomed add-on would be wheels for rolling about & increasing the load capacity to 600+ lbs. It's a great bench for novices or those who can't afford a commercial-grade incline bench.
customer_reviews.author: W. K.

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice takes up little space
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 30 min to set up with the help of my 3 year old but someone with out that help could get it done in about 20. It looks nice takes up little space. I am 5,7 and I felt it was too small for me but I got the hang of it now and its just right. I would not recommend this for someone who is any taller than say 5,10 or your head will be in the air or your butt thats up to you. Ladies will fit nicely on it. Hope this helps you make up your mind.
customer_reviews.author: Semper Fi

customer_reviews.title: Great bench
customer_reviews.text: Great bench for the price. I am 6’2” and 235 lbs and frequently use 55lb dumbbells. No worries are problems. The only thing to be aware of is that it will not go at a 90 degree angle. But if a bummer but still good bench for the price
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with the quality for the price (I got lucky at $99). Padding seemed thick and durable, metal parts seemed heavy. The balance is ok, although I do wish the back support of the bench was bit more solid on inclined positions (just a bit of wiggle). Does this compare to a $250+ bench commonly found at the gym? No. But I definitely didn't expect it to be. I'm very happy with the purchase and would recommend it for the price range.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Putting the bench together was so easy and I was done assembling in less than half ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. The box was lighter than I imagined it would be. Putting the bench together was so easy and I was done assembling in less than half hour once everything was unpacked. It turned out to be a pretty sturdy bench.
customer_reviews.author: SweetPea

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and very easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I just received it. It was a snap to put together...very easy assembly. The quality and construction are excellent. I am going to use it for light workouts at home but it is capable of so much more.
customer_reviews.author: webmail33

customer_reviews.title: This is a really great bench, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great bench, especially for the price. Perfect for what it's needs, cheap, sturdy, easy to put together, BUT the back doesn't have a lock to it. I live in an apartment, and moving this thing back an forth can be a bitch seeing as the back can move around. Only held in position by gravity. A great design and perfect for what you need it for, especially for the price. If I could give it 4.5 stars I would have, but I felt like they could of added some type of locking mechanism to it for moving it around.
customer_reviews.author: David Brown

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, High Quality, And Adjusts To Plenty Of Angles
customer_reviews.text: I like the angles that this machine can be set at. This is perfect for me to pull up to the television and work out while watching a favorite show. It's easy to carry from one location to another and it's easily survived moving to a new home twice. It was definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Jegason Diviant

customer_reviews.title: Good starter workout equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Good starter bench for doing lighter workouts at home. The construction feels a little shaky, and isn't as sturdy as I'd like. Therefore, I keep it light and don't go too crazy. Adequate for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Seat is made of cheap particle board, will break
customer_reviews.text: I found this item to be great especially for the price. But the bottom part of the seat is made from cheap particle board. Only had this for a year with only occasional use and it has already cracked and become unsafe to use. Wish I would have just spent a little more to get a nice bench that wouldn't give out so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: james goode

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I love the bench. The quality is great and so is the price. I think it would go toe-to-toe with other benches out there for much more expensive prices. I have had it for 6 months and it is holding up great. Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bench for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: Love this bench for the price! My family has used this bench daily for the past 2 months and it has been great. The guys & gals that use this, use it to do Flys with weights, presses with weights, sit-ups with weights, standing/leaning push-ups, etc on it. So far, it is holding up. I look forward to updating my review in 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: ShakeNUp

customer_reviews.title: it's ok, but you can find something better for sure
customer_reviews.text: I had before this one a very cheap multiple position bench... but it's not better on every aspect... For instance, I can't do dragon flags because it feels that it's going to break... The surface is extremely soft, I thought it was a good thing but it makes some exercises a bit uncomfortable in fact I think it's a good bench for beginners... even though it doesn't do 90o which bothers me..
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for the price! I use this everyday when I work out and it is comfortable. It is easy to adjust the angle. The material is comfortable and it is decently padded. So far, it is holding up well- no rips or indentations.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie D

customer_reviews.title: It's good for the most part
customer_reviews.text: It's good for the most part. I wish it would position in a complete 90 degree angle for shoulder work. Also, the foam ankle supports come off, as do the black plastic pieces on the bottom of the frame and on the part that adjusts the angle.
customer_reviews.author: KC Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Goldilocks bench for a home gym - not too big, not too small, not too cheap, not too expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. Sturdy and "weighty" without being bulky or unwieldy. Feels secure and solid underneath me while I'm lifting, but I can move it around with ease. As a woman, I'm always a bit concerned that benches will be too wide for me, but this one is perfect. And assembly was pretty easy, too. You could do it with one person, although the hubs and I did it together.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice size bench for an apartment. I'm a Senior woman and I can move it around easily and I like that it adjusts easily (no pins to move). Perfect for my workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Have had it a long time like maybe 2 years. I'm just now leaving the review lol Starting to crack and spiderweb but has had a few days a week on it for 2 years
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An excellent basic weight bench.
customer_reviews.text: This bench is great for basic weight lifting. Good quality materials for the price. The padding is firm but comfortable. I do foresee the stitching wearing down first after a year or two of sweat and just wear and tear. The bench is just the right size for me, if possibly a bit small (I'm 6 feet tall), but I do have to make sure I sit right at the edge when I lie back. My purposes for choosing this bench are to augment some of the exercises in P90X. I have to fight a low drop ceiling so I need to be able to do some exercises in a seated or lying position. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Worth EVERY penny
customer_reviews.text: FAST DELIVERY! What an incredible product! Manfuctaured to last with quality materials! EASY ASSEMBLY! I could not be any happier with this transaction and highly recommend this to anyone looking for an adjustable weight bench.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but seems a bit short for tall folks
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well built bench and wasn't hard to put together at all. My only complaint about it is that the seat/back configuration doesn't quite seem to fit my body when I lie on my back for dumbbell bench press and similar exercises. It might be my height (6') or leg to torso ratio, I don't know but it just doesn't feel right and I find myself scootching up and down the bench to try to make it work. I have grown used to it and for the price I still think it is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It wasn't very difficult to put together (although the actual page of directions was not as precise as some others I have seen)
customer_reviews.text: Very basic bench that has been fabulous for my son (who uses it to lift dumbbells). It wasn't very difficult to put together (although the actual page of directions was not as precise as some others I have seen) and it is a very sturdy piece of equipment for what our son uses it for. Two thumbs up for us on this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Birdsong

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my bench
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my bench! Easy to assemble and very close to the sturdiness found in professional gym equipment. Universal hasn't lost their quality.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: leg/ankle attachment is flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: This universal five position bench does what its supposed to; however the leg insert, foam rollers, and end caps are beyond flimsy--the end caps fall off just by touching the attachment! At this price point I expected much more quality. I say this because my last bench was a four position universal bench from Wal Mart that cost only $35 and its leg rest attachment was much more solid.
customer_reviews.author: green machine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Good quality. A perfect size bench for my smaller work out room as well as for me (I'm only 5'1"). Would probably be too tiny/flimsy for a man of good size using heavier weights than I am but I love it for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Good bench however didn't realize that the picture shown is ...
customer_reviews.text: Good bench however didn't realize that the picture shown is as high as the back would go. I was expecting a 90 degree angle to be the highest setting. Really just an incline or flat bench with a couple of in-between selections. Easy to assemble though, and I'm a bigger guy(230), and have no issues with stability.
customer_reviews.author: SummaB

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Only negative, as others said, is that it doesn't sit straight up with the back straight. Otherwise, can do every position, putting it together was easy, no additional tools required. Build quality is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Put the whole thing together and one of the last ...
customer_reviews.text: Put the whole thing together and one of the last parts to put in was stripped so I couldn't insert the screw. They wanted me to send this whole thing back instead of just sending me a parts package.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not for shoulder day
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good quality Nice materials Super easy to adjust Great for all targeting chest at all angles Can also be used to target front shoulders Easy to assemble Cons: The most vertical position is the one in the picture, not sufficiently vertical to target side shoulders like in a standard shoulder press
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great weight bench
customer_reviews.text: Great weight bench. Does exactly what I need it to do. Sturdy, easy to adjust, doesn't take up a lot of space. As for the lack of instructions to put the thing together - REALLY people??? It has a maximum of Ten pieces and clearly only goes together one way! Yes, there are no written instructions, but the picture is more than adequate to help one assemble the 10 parts into a working weight bench. I am normally not really handy with putting things together and it only took me about 15 minutes to assemble. If I can put this thing together easily without "instructions" anyone can!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. L.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good and cheap bench if you're not going too ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good and cheap bench if you're not going too heavy.......says 300lb weight limit......but of course I went over 400 counting my weight together......worked just fine....for now
customer_reviews.author: Blade4glory1999

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We've had this bench for several months now. No problems at all. Quick easy setup. Has been a very nice addition to our workout room.
customer_reviews.author: M_Ammons

customer_reviews.title: Padding ok - easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Padding ok - easy to assemble. Does not include a vertical position for shoulder exercises - this would have been easy to do but just overlooked. Also, the grommets that hold the foam leg pads in place at lower front of bench pop out continuously and have to be put back.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Great value, easy to assemble and adjust!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this as a gift and it was super well received. The gift recipient said it was super easy to assemble and he was working out it no time. It is very sturdy and the user can do a multitude of exercises without being worried about falling off. Easy to adjust the angle as well as maneuver around if needed to. Compared to other brands available, this was the best value and it has held up to daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: ... about 3 or 4 days a week and I love it. There were no directions on how to ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this bench about 3 or 4 days a week and I love it. There were no directions on how to put it together, just a picture. I put it together in about 30-45 mins. I wish there was more of an incline but overall good addition to my home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Heald

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I searched around for the best bench that would support my 240lbs and then 100lb dumbbells. I decided to buy this one and I am glad I did. The install was easy and this is a very sturdy product. This bench supports be very easily and is light enough for my wife to move around. There is also a 15 degree decline as well that really helps out as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jutsinger

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I wish was different is a spot to put plates on the front for leg exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn & Alex

customer_reviews.title: Probably better suited for people not as tall as I am
customer_reviews.text: Its an okay bench, I'm 6'5" 215lbs and it supports me standing on it/using it for lunges, among other workouts (bought it for beachbodys hammer and chisel). The plastic ends don't stay on too well, and it has limited positions. Probably better suited for people not as tall as I am, but price wise its an OK bench
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Solid. Simple. Easy to Assemble.
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat hesitant to order a bench priced around 100.00 bucks. A few of the reviews stated it was unstable, difficult to assemble, and for beginners. Nothing could be further from the truth. I put this together in under 15 minutes, with tools that THEY PROVIDE. Once together, it was easy to maneuver, slide into position, and away I went. ...after a disappointing visit to my local gym source where I was told I would have to spend 700 dollars, I am beyond delighted that 100 bucks still goes a long way. Click add to cart and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Yardis

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Good quality. Very ergonomic and feels safe when you workout. I am 220lb and together with the dumbbells over 300lb it feels stable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't get it for sit ups
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice adjustable bench for light weigh exercises. I do not recommend this for sit ups. While doing sit up, the butt is inconveniently placed at the gap.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: for its price its definitely worth it but it wont be as good as the gym benches
customer_reviews.text: bench that works, for its price its definitely worth it but it wont be as good as the gym benches
customer_reviews.author: alex chung

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, but lacking in a few areas
customer_reviews.text: The bench is very good quality, sturdy and easy to put together. The material is decently soft, and resistant to moisture. The padding is foam, covered with vinyl, so very water-resistant. My only real complaint, is that it lacks an upright position, though it would be so easy for it to do so. The seat will even go into that position, and 'seems' to stay for a while, making one presume it may have been designed to do so. It is a good deal, but don't expect the optimum bench.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Pooley

customer_reviews.title: Great budget weight Bench
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Bench for a while now and it has held up very nice so far. I always cover it with a towel while using it and was easy to put together. It would be better if you could adjust the seat to tilt as well but you cannot.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: and by far the best price I had found
customer_reviews.text: This has been exactly what I needed, and by far the best price I had found. Easy to put together and very sturdy. I like that it doesn't have a lot of parts to wear out or break, and it's nice to adjust the back tilt without having to fuss with pins each time. Highly recommend for someone who wants an inexpensive well-made bench.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bargain Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely sturdy bench!! easy assembly (the ones saying it is difficult just cannot read a diagram) no issues with missing parts. Takes up very little space, lightweight and easy to move, yet a solid bench! extremely satisfied with the varieties of incline, but wish it would have a vertical position as well as an actual decline. If you are buying looking for a decline bench as well, DO NOT BUY!!!! it is literally about a 2% decline aka not at all. other than the lack of vertical and decline positioning along with a lower weight limit, it is an amazing bench for under $100, excellent!!
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my weight room
customer_reviews.text: The bench is much sturdier than I thought it would be but is still compact. Quick assembly in spite of the lack of instructions...pretty much intuitive. I would have awarded five stars but the bench is a little too tall to let me put my feet flat on the floor while lifting. The width is perfect for dumb bell flyes (I am 5-11, 205 lbs) and the length is good for skull krushers...very comfortable in fact. Bench is steady in all positions. Very good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Bioguy

customer_reviews.title: Good mechanically, bad durability...
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this bench works very well mechanically, but it is not durable at all. In fact, it came damaged with a tear in the material on the back support...I didn't realize the damage until I had already assembled the unit. I would look elsewhere for a bench with a more durable material...
customer_reviews.author: lilmtnwolf

customer_reviews.title: Good Bench, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I got this bench to use with a set of adjustable dumbbells I bought, and am quite please with it's performance. It's built really well, and easily supports 280lbs (my body weight plus what I'm lifting). I use it in a number of different positions and have never felt as though it was going to tip over. It is also quite compact, yet supports my 6'1" / 185cm height sufficiently well. The backrest tilting and foot/shin bar are also nice features. Overall, I'd give it a 95 out of 100. Pros: Great Price Quite Sturdy Nice Features Compact Cons: Lack of Head Support for Taller Individuals
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

product_meta.title: Universal UB300 Adjustable Bench
product_meta.description:
The Universal UB300 Adjustable Bench is an ideal workout station for dozens of exercises. The contoured pads and sides provide comfort, while the 8 foam rollers anchor your feet in place. The bench is readily adjustable with five-position settings from -10 to 45.

AMAZON.COM
The simple, effective challenge of a free weight workout remains one of the most efficient ways to build strength and muscle mass. The Universal Five-Position bench, from parent company Nautilus, offers positions of -10, 0, 15, 30, and 45 degrees, and dozens of exercises to challenge your entire core and upper body. Its contoured shape and five-inch foam rollers ensure a safe and comfortable workout, while stabilizer levelers provide a stable base on almost any type of flooring. The bench measures 17 by 25 by 51 inches (W x H x D). It has a 250-pound maximum user weight and a maximum combined user weight and lift load of 430 pounds.
